title: Jaguar Land Rover DHL contractor is found dead in a loading bay at the car giant's Liverpool plant
text:
Man is believed to be an agency worker employed by DHL doing contract work

Emergency services called to the loading bay of Halewood, Liverpool plant

The body of an agency worker thought to be in his 50s was found at the Jaguar Land Rover site in Halewood, Liverpool yesterday morning, it has been confirmed.

Horrified colleagues discovered the man's body in a loading bay following a 'serious incident', before alerting emergency services.

The man is understood to have worked for DHL, which has a contract with Jaguar to provide services at the site.

The body of an agency worker thought to be in his 50s was found at the Jaguar Land Rover site in Halewood, Liverpool yesterday morning

Staff described how Merseyside Police officers and ambulances quickly arrived at the scene at around 6am and recovered the body of a man thought to be his 50s.

A spokeswoman for Jaguar said: 'We can confirm there was a serious incident at our Halewood site this morning involving the death of an agency colleague.

'The incident is now being investigated by Merseyside Police.

'Our thoughts and condolences are with the family of our colleague at this time.

A spokeswoman for JLR said: 'We can confirm there was a serious incident at our Halewood site this morning involving the death of an agency colleague'

The plant, which is on an industrial estate close to the River Mersey, has planned to halt production for a week from November 4 for maintenance

'We will be working closely with DHL to ensure we provide full support to employees affected by the incident.'

DHL have been contacted for comment.

The plant, which is on an industrial estate close to the River Mersey, has planned to halt production for a week from November 4 for maintenance.

It was reported in September that CEO Ralph Speth said the factory, which employs 4,000 people, cannot find the space to stockpile the millions of parts it needs every day.
description: The worker, thought to be a man in his 50s, was found in the loading bay of the Jaguar Land Rover plant in Halewood, Liverpool. It is believed he was an agency worker employed by DHL.
